thread.title: Timo Werner happy at Leipzig but says playing at Liverpool would be 'special'
thread.title_full: Timo Werner happy at Leipzig but says playing at Liverpool would be 'special'

author: Stephan Uersfeld
title: Timo Werner happy at Leipzig but says playing at Liverpool would be 'special'
text:
Timo Werner happy at Leipzig but says playing at Liverpool would be 'special' Timo Werner has impressed with 14 goals for RB Leipzig this season so far. 
Germany international Timo Werner has told Sport Bild it would be "special" to play at Liverpool in the future, but stressed that his immediate future lies in the Bundesliga. 
RB Leipzig forward Werner has been linked with a move to Anfield after an impressive season. 
The 21-year-old, who has scored 14 goals to help his side to second place in the top flight, said: "If you were to play at Anfield and hear the fans sing 'You'll Never Walk Alone,' it would certainly be something special. 
"England has a different feel, but I am also still young player." 
Werner is expected to make his debut for Germany against England on Wednesday and said he wanted to stay in the Bundesliga for now. 
"I feel at home here at RB right now," he added. "Leipzig can continue to grow, and if I could be part it I'd be delighted." 
Stephan Uersfeld is the Germany correspondent for ESPN FC. Follow him on Twitter @uersfeld.
